definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
die-hard otaku (sb who hardly ever emerges from their home, where they play games, watch movies etc)
to await job assignment (term used only in mainland China)
(deprecatory) to lie motionless (asleep, drunk, lazing etc)
(coll.) to live with and depend on one's parents even upon reaching adulthood
(coll.) adults still living with and depending on their parents
(Tw) (neologism c. 2007) young person who is not studying, working or being trained for work (loanword from NEET: not in education, employment or training)
to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)
a guy who stays at home all the time, typically spending a lot of time playing online games (derived from Japanese "otaku")
to skip work/to sneak out of work early
